Datatable.LocalizationPair: Fore Sagazh Jabble

Growing up, Jabble never quite had the wit and the reflexes to match their curiosity. Adolescence was one long series of accidents and hospitalizations as Jabble wandered into places they shouldn’t have and pulled on levers with large “Do Not Touch” signs. Finally, one day, fate turned against them, and Jabble found their way into a discarded engine core that had been used for testing a highly radioactive Dust-enhanced ramscoop. Assaulted by the forces that shape the boundaries of space-time, a wiser being might have died of terror and relentless perspective. Jabble simply thought, “Wow, cool”, and passed out. Upon awakening it was clear that they were no longer the same creature, but would have continued their carefree existence had not an explorer ship sent by Ighszraasz the Distrustful arrived to study the planet. Awed by the Academy and the incredible amount of neat stuff to check out, Jabble became a happy member of the society of Heroes.
Basryxo

This society evolved in the detritus of what is essentially a garbage planet, as myriad forms of waste were dumped on the world for centuries. Whatever starfaring race created this ecological disaster we do not know, but eons after their passing a new sentient life—perhaps remnants of the original civilization, perhaps something else that evolved in the mutation-rich environment—came to be. Starting from ragged scavengers to become pragmatic and efficient recyclers, they have learned to turn garbage into gold. Any planet lucky enough to welcome them will quickly see the effectiveness of their methods for recovering resources.
Munchie Madness

The coolest, tastiest treat across the galaxy is a new fast food, Haroshuarm, a traditional snack of the Haroshem. The trend has taken settled planets like a storm, and anywhere you go you can buy or order a couple of pre-fermented slabs of this cheap, delicious fodder. Unfortunately, the incredible leap in take-out consumption has created vast quantities of garbage, exacerbated by the fact that decaying Haroshuarm turns into a corrosive gas. As a result, waste treatment plants and trash collection companies are staggering under mountains of cardboard and plastic rubbish that is slowly devolving into toxic waste. It is a particular challenge for the Basryxo, who pride themselves on turning trash into treasure. Ths time, they may have met their match.
HAPPINESS
The masses are content? Let's keep them that way!
Your Empire Approval directly depends on the Approval of your Systems.
Nice work! Other than some minor side issues like obesity and flatulence, everybody is happy--except the Basryxo, who still can't figure out how to get rid of all the effluent.
Have your Empire Approval [happinessColored] at $MinimumEmpireHappinessName or more for $HappinessDurationName [turnColored]
Winning epic battles is a good way to earn more Keii. Bring it on!
Have your Obedience [obedienceColored] at $MinimumEmpireHonorName or more for $HonorDurationName [turnColored]
CLEANLINESS
The party is over, and it's time to clean up. Somebody has to be the responsible one...
You can unlock more Law slots by unlocking higher stages of the Empire Development technology quadrant.

Your Edict for Non-lethal Packaging and Waste Reduction has been a great success. The new recyclable, absorptive Haroshuarm boxes are a great help in reducing piles of waste, and the city streets are once again navigable. Rumor has it, however, that the natural curiosity of the Basryxo has driven them to finding a process to convert the old heaps of refuse into salt, hydrogen, carbon fiber, and chocolate.
Have $EcologistLawAmountName active #B0C65D#Ecologist#REVERT# [ecologistColored] Laws for $EcologistLawDurationName [turnColored]
KINDNESS
Be magnanimous! If it's better food they want, give it to them.
You can increase Food production through Planetary and System Improvements, some Hero Skills, increased Population, and using Food-oriented Luxury Resources for System Upgrade projects.

What!? Those ingrates. You have showered them with food--almost literally--and now they are complaining about it. The only happy bunch are the cardiologists; all your other citizens are unhappy, and you need to deal with them.
Produce at least $FoodObjectiveAmountName [foodColored] per turn in one System
Food Hangover
Hmmm. The masses may be happy, but the streets are a mess... There must be a clever way to fix this.
CLEVERNESS
You have a problem that needs fixing; and you might be able to science your way out of it....
You can increase a system's Science output by building more Science-related Improvements.

As the Basryxo say, "Mind over muck". By developing new systems for garbage removal, improved yeast strains, and self-cleaning sacks for the food, ecological disaster is avoided and the Haoshuarm craze continues. Grab a mallet, a chisel, and dig in!
Produce at least $ScienceObjectiveAmountName [scienceColored] per turn in one System
EFFECTIVENESS
You have a problem that needs fixing; maybe more waste collection and incineration capacity will do it.
You can increase a system's Industry output by building more Industry-related Improvements.

The volume of Haroshuarm-generated refuse has increased, but self-purging sidewalks, miniaturized incinerators, and orbital garbage strike technology takes care of it without worry. Your people are free to indulge, and the Basryxo can return to their lead/gold research.
Produce at least $IndustryObjectiveAmountName [industryColored] per turn in one System
Happy, but not Healthy
We managed to increase agricultural output. But now that the population has plenty to eat, they're starting to riot over the quality--and the health consequences.
HEARTLESSNESS
If they aren't on your planet, they can't make trouble. It's time for some good, old-fashioned press gangs.
You can build the Ship, upgrade an already existing Ship, or buy one from the Marketplace

Those who love Haroshuarm stay, and those who complain about it, well, they aren't in the news any more. Recruitment is up, unrest is down, and the Basryxo are wondering if they can turn all that glorious waste into orbital cities. Hmmmm....
Build, buy, or Assimilate a Ship with at least $ManpowerObjectiveAmountName [shipCrewColored]
SURLINESS
Take a lesson from the bestselling "Craver Management Manual", and oppress the complainers
You can unlock more Law slots by unlocking higher stages of the Empire Development technology quadrant.

You didn't make many friends, and the jails are running at capacity. But now the rule of law has been re-imposed, and there is a reason why it was relatively easy: After all, there is no Haroshuarm in prison.
Have $MilitaristLawAmountName active #B82738#Militarist#REVERT# [militaristColored] Laws for $MilitaristLawDurationName [turnColored]
Muck and Makers

Thanks to your massive participation in last January’s free weekend, you unlocked all the available rewards! The Basryxo minor faction is now available with its new hero and a quest full of rubbish… Unlock it on Games2Gether.com!
Pacific Proletariat
These workers toil even harder when they are not distracted by news of war and destruction.
Bountiful Byproducts
This population has a talent for creating goods that have more than one use.
Basryxo Citizens
+1 [basryxo] on your Home System
The faction starts with Basryxo population on their home planet.
Basryxo
A meticulous, introspective people, the Basryxo focus on recycling, reuse, and the environment.
Edict for Extreme Measures in Extreme Settings

Given the already fragile ecosystems of certain planets, careful measures are taken to install and develop extreme and experimental agricultural techniques that are highly productive without undue environmental impact.
